issue.title: RGBD camera range longer than specified

content.raw:
no, this is not fixed.

As @{557058:44b40072-c04b-41ae-ad09-376db9ebffa1}  said, the RGBD camera implementation in ignition does clipping using the Z position of a point \(in camera frame\) as opposed the distance to the point so if the ‘range’  may be larger than 10m but the Z value should not be larger than 10m. 

Additional work need to be done if we want to support clipping based on distance to point.

‌
content.html:
no, this is not fixed.

As @GoRobotGo said, the RGBD camera implementation in ignition does clipping using the Z position of a point (in camera frame) as opposed the distance to the point so if the ‘range’ may be larger than 10m but the Z value should not be larger than 10m.

Additional work need to be done if we want to support clipping based on distance to point.

‌
